repnme.cdata!:
Azerbaijan - Highly Pathogenic Avian
            Influenza Preparedness Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Highly Pathogenic Avian
            Influenza Preparedness Project for Azerbaijan were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            the government commitment and implementation capacity of the
            project should have been assessed independently of the
            concomitantly designed adjustment operation. The task team
            repeatedly discussed these problems with the Government, but
            without success in gaining an early decision on how these
            reforms should proceed whiles the disbursements continued at
            a slow pace. This underlines the importance of more in-depth
            risk analysis in project design and during implementation.
            Testing projects on a pilot basis is important to their
            success. Restructuring the treasury operation was an
            important part of the project. Effective coordination of
            activities with other donors and projects requires time and
            can delay implementation. The decision to restructure the
            project was opportune at that time because it quickly and
            effectively assisted the Government with addressing the
            pressing needs for Avian Influenza (AI) mitigation.

Azerbaijan - Highly Pathogenic Avian
            Influenza Preparedness Project

repnme.cdata!:
Azerbaijan - Avian Influenza Preparedness
            Project : environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental management plan for
            the Azerbaijan Avian Influenza Preparedness Project
            addresses the moderate adverse environmental effects of the
            Veterinary and Human Health Components.  For the Veterinary
            Services component, the EMP addresses zoonotic disease
            containment  and waste management as pertain to special
            waste, emissions and materials at laboratories, and training
            for veterinary services workers, to include procedures for
            safe handling of AI materials; safe culling of infected and
            at-risk poultry; and disposal of carcasses.  Specifically,
            mitigation measures include using soil as overfill; using
            fencing and implementing a comprehensive security strategy
            to prevent contamination; sealing covered containers and
            transport vehicles; using disinfectant and sprays to wash
            down vehicles; placing carcasses in bags; covering carcasses
            with lime before burial; using impermeable surfaces to
            prevent leaching; and collecting and storing the
            disinfectant used. For the Human Health component, the EMP
            focuses on equipment, refurbishing and training for
            reference and regional diagnostic laboratories to include
            key environmental issues in zoonotic disease containment and
            waste management. The EMP provides mitigation plans and
            monitoring plans to ensure appropriate attention to
            environmental issues, and to tracking progress or problems
            in their management.

repnme.cdata!:
Azerbaijan - Second Institution Building
            Technical Assistance Project - proposed project
            restructuring and amendment of the development credit agreement

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Institution Building
            Technical Assistance Project development objectives will be
            amended to include minimization of the threat posed to
            humans by HPAI infection and other zoonoses in domestic
            poultry and preparation for the control and response to an
            influenza pandemic and other infectious diseases. To achieve
            the additional project objectives, the project will support:
            (i) prevention; (ii) preparedness and planning; and (iii)
            response and containment. Achieving these goals will
            contribute to diminishing the burden of disease and loss of
            productivity, limiting the regional spread of HPAI, and
            enhancing economic and social safety at the national,
            regional, and global levels.

441265.trustfund:
TF026109-PHRD-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT

repnme.cdata!:
Azerbaijan - Second Institution Building
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Institution Building
            Technical Assistance Project is intended to provide
            technical assistance to support the policy measures to be
            implemented under the Second Structural Adjustment Credit
            (SAC II) (report no. P7512), which focus on improving
            transparency and accountability in public financial
            management; strengthening the tracking of poverty-reducing
            public expenditures and monitoring their impact; improving
            the strategic priority setting and transparency of public
            expenditures; and promoting private sector development. In
            line with these objectives, the Credit has the twin goals of
            providing assistance in the design and implementation of the
            Government's reform program, and of helping to build up
            the institutional capacity and skills to carry out these
            programs. The Credit has four components: 1) enhancing
            accountability in public financial management by supporting
            effective institutional arrangements for implementing the
            public procurement law; and assisting in designing and
            developing an institutional capacity for the Chamber of
            Accounts; 2) strengthening public expenditure management by
            automating the treasury system; 3) reforming social
            expenditures by reviewing health expenditures, strengthening
            the effectiveness of educational expenditures, defining an
            effective safety net strategy, building the capacity of the
            State Statistical Office, and providing pre-layoff
            assistance to workers; and 4) promoting privatization and
            private sector development.

Azerbaijan - Second Institution Building
